metadata.subject: Information Regarding Water Supply
metadata.sender: Sarah E. Hannah, Assistant Town Manager

relationships.description: Independent water quality testing and analysis

analysis.purpose: To provide comprehensive information about water supply options and quality for the Water Committee meeting
analysis.significance: Documents municipal water infrastructure planning and addresses public health concerns about water quality

notable_quotes: The City produces a safe drinking water of high quality based on the test results over the last several years.
To eliminate the presence of microbiologics, such as Coliform bacteria, the City applies chlorine at the treatment plant to disinfect the processed supply water.
HSA concludes that the quality of the potable water product delivered to the Town by the City meets or beats the criteria for the standards established under rule 62-550, F.A.C.
red_flags: Elevated THM levels during 2007 boil water notice
Concerns about water taste and disinfection byproducts

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this municipal water supply document

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - document pertains to municipal water supply management

public_knowledge.context: Municipal water supply information is typically public record and of local interest

analysis.summary: This document package contains comprehensive information about Palm Beach's water supply options, including desalination and Floridan Aquifer treatment plants, water quality testing results, and consumption data. It addresses concerns about water safety following a 2007 boil water notice and concludes that West Palm Beach provides safe drinking water that meets all regulatory standards.
